key_title: Key to the species of Chorizandra

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Cyperaceae

source.author: Wilson, K.L.
source.title: Cyperaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Wilson, K.L. (1994). Cyperaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescence globose to hemispherical, with core raised, conical to globose; main involucral bract not sheathing inflorescence, mostly not red-dotted (occasionally so in C. australis); culms longitudinally ridged but not warty

Inflorescence narrow-ovoid to ovoid (rarely globose), with core not or scarcely raised, oblong to ovate; main involucral bract ± sheathing sides of inflorescence, red-dotted; culms usually minutely warty as well as longitudinally ridged
Glumes ciliate, sometimes minutely so, towards apex; leaves and involucral bract pluritubular
Glumes glabrous; culms, leaves and involucral bract unitubular (culms often pluritubular below)
Culms, leaves and involucral bract pluritubular, grey-green; nut minutely papillose when viewed with hand lens
Culms unitubular, yellow-green; leaves and involucral bract pluritubular, yellow-green; nut not minutely papillose when viewed with hand lens
